data.description: General understanding of humans in relation to cultures, evolutionary development and racial diversity, capacities for society, and the development of the world's major cultures.
data.title: GENERAL ANTHROPOLOGY

data.description: Identifies and examines cultural and environmental factors which should be taken into account in planning effective development. Case studies of development programs in less developed countries. Possible contributions of anthropologists and environmental scientists in planning, implementing, and evaluating development programs.
data.title: ANTHROPOLOGY, ENVIRONMENT, AND DEVELOPMENT

data.description: Introduction to cultural anthropology. Comparative cross-cultural consideration of social organization, economics, politics, language, religion, ecology, gender, and cultural change. Includes a primary focus on U.S. ethnic and racial minorities.
data.title: CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGY AND HUMAN DIVERSITY
